risinfo.chaptertitle: 14. Sexual Dysfunctions, Gender Dysphoria, and Paraphilic Disorders

sect1.title: Impact of Gender, Race, Culture, and Other Aspects of Diversity
sect1.para: An extensive discussion discussion of the impact of race, culture, diversity, and age on sexual dysfunctions, gender dysphoria, and paraphilic disorders is beyond the scope of this chapter (refer to Hall & Graham, 2013 for a book focusing on sexuality). In all therapies, an interconnectedness perspective can hold much explanatory and clinical potential. Among other recommendations, Hardy and Laszloffy ( 2002 ) encourage therapists to view all therapy as cross-cultural and to engage in a constant process of self-exploration. More practically, it is essential for therapists to work respectfully within clients’ religious and other beliefs and to recognize diversity in experiences, orientations, genders genders , and sociocultural circumstances. To this end, the DSM-5 Handbook on the Cultural Formulation Interview (Lewis-Fernández et al., 2016) may be be a useful resource.
